column2: Princeton University does not consider student comment information provided to be official University course evaluation data; it does not take that information into consideration in approving courses for permanent status; and it does not take the information into consideration in making tenure or promotion decisions.

column3: What advice would you give to another student considering taking this course?

column1: Professor Nagel is by far one of my favorite professors at Princeton and so student-first that I could never ask for a better teacher. No matter what subject material she teaches, it's always inspiring and she has really helped me grow.

Professor Nagel is brilliant, thoughtful and cares greatly for her students. I found Professor Nagel to approach texts in ways I haven't ever encountered before and found her close attention to affect and rhetoric to push my thinking and how I analyze texts in new directions. Definitely take a course with Professor Nagel if given the chance. The reading assigned for the course is both fascinating and manageable; the highlight of the course were the novels and novellas that we read. The writing work load is on the lighter side in comparison to other German courses I have taken.

Professor Nagel is well-read, passionate, and kind. She's a great teacher in general, and she was great in this course. If you're looking for a stimulating upper-level German course with a thoughtful professor, look no further.

Take any course with Professor Nagel that you can! She is a brilliant facilitator of discussion and extremely helpful when speaking in German. The material is well selected and incredibly interesting. TAKE THIS COURSE!!
Yes take it. Professor Nagel is one of the best professors at this school. She is so knowledgable and so cool.
TAKE THIS COURSE WITH PROFESSOR NAGEL.
Take this class if you're interested in the topic. You will learn a lot from the readings and class discussion.
